miic.core.macro.one_step_vchange_estimate_and_plot¶

one_step_vchange_estimate_and_plot(base_dir, suffix, save_dir, center_win_len=1500, fmax=1.0, fmin=0.5, order=4, fs=10.0, smooth_win=5, tw_start_list=[40, 60, 80], tw_len=[100, 100, 100], st_range=0.01, st_steps=1000, list_of_combinations=[], start_day='03/04/2010', stop_day='03/04/2011', all=False, marker_day=None, old_style=False)[source]¶

One step function to do the velocity change estimation and plot

This function wants to group together everything is necessary to move from the single auto-cross correlation functions to the velocity change estimation and plot in one step. It collates together the three macro functions vchange_estimate, from_single_pattern_to_panel and create_plots_macro plus the creation of a standard directory structure to hold all the produced results in a consistent way plus a configuration file that stores all the parameters that have been adopted to produce them.

Parameters:
  • base_dir (directory) – Where the auto-cross correlation matrix are stored
  • save_dir (directory) – Where all results will be saved (see Notes for details)
  • center_win_len (int) – How many samples will be taken from the central part of the corr func
  • fmax (float) – Maximum freq for the bandpass filter
  • fmin (float) – Minimum freq for the bandpass filter
  • order (int) – Filter order (i.e. corners in obspy terminology)
  • fs (float) – Sampling frequency for the corr trace
  • smooth_win (int) – Width of the smoothing window
  • tw_start_list (list of int) – List of time lag (in samples) that we want to adopt in the velocity change evaluation
  • tw_len (list of int) – Time window length in samples for each time lag
  • st_range (float) – Stretching range (i.e. 0.01 -> 1%)
  • st_steps (int) – How many stretching steps in the specified range
  • list_of_combinations (list of string) – The list of combinations that we want to plot (e.g. [‘QC01-QC02’,’QC05-QC11’]
  • all (bool) – If true all available combinations are ploted
  • start_day (~datetime.date object) – Starting day
  • stop_day (~datetime.date object) – Stoplting day
  • marker_day (~datetime.date object) – If passed a vertical red line will be plotted at this date.
  • suffix (string) – Optional suffix for the filename to look for (it must be the same as used with the vchange_estimate function through with the corr ad dv/v curves were created)
  • old_style (bool) – If true, the suffic is generated using the fs ( “_<fs>Hz”) instead of being passed as a parameter)

Notes

The directories structure that will be created under save_dir has this layout:

save_dir
|——> panels |——> img |vchange_files

panels stores the Panel objects img stores all produced images In save_dir is also stored a configuration.txt file that contains all the parameters in the currunt setup in the for of key->value pairs.
